result.execSummary:
The defendant JAMES C SCOTT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -No huber, out-of-county service or out-of-county travel. Court grants defendant 2 days of sentence credit if probation is revoked.

miscConds.notes: -To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-No Violent Contact with the victim.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

supervisions.notes: -Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

-CASH BOND APPLIED leaving a balance of $393.00. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JAMES C SCOTT

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for JAMES C SCOTT
Current: 134 W Liberty St, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 09-06-2022)
Prior: 310 Darling St Apt 2, Berlin, WI 54923 
(Per defendant in person)

2:30 PM Defendant JAMES C SCOTT in court.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received an offer and will accept the offer. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. ADA recites agreement - upon the defendant entering a plea to one count of Disorderly Conduct and count 2, will recommend imposes and stayed jail and probation on the DC and jail, costs and DNA sample on count 2. Further statement by ADA - will agree not to charge for a uncharged read-in of obstructing/resisting. Defendant concurs and will enter a GUILTY plea to count 1 and count 2.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 2 as charged and orders count 3 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Sentencing statement by DA. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 1

-30 days county jail. stayed and places the defendant on probation for 2 years. No huber, out of county service or out of county travel.

CONDITIONS:

-No Violent Contact with the victim.
-AODA and any follow-up. 
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

COUNT 2

-30 days county jail. Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel. 
-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Cash bond to be applied to count 2 first.

Court grants 2 days of sentence credit if revoked on count 1.

Court adjourned at  2:43 PM
Status hearing on March 23, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

No Violent Contact with the victim o the victim's residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

No Violent Contact with the victim or the victim's residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

9:43 AM Defendant JAMES C SCOTT appeared in court, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Court determines the defendant stands mute and enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on his behalf. Def would like to meet with the DA to see if a resolution can be met. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Court sets Status Hearing March 23, 2022 at 2:45 PM. Court notes bond has been set. Statement by DA Laspisa. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Defendant makes bond recommendation. Court keeps bond at $150 cash bond and conditions of: No violent contact with the victim. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.   

Court adjourned at 9:48 AM.
